intro: Phaeopsis, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that resemble cups, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Phaeopsis species are perennial herbs with slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. They play an important role in ecological systems by providing food and habitat for various insects and wildlife.
